A single-producer, single-consumer queue, implemented as a ring buffer, suitable for when the capacity is known at compile-time.

Imports

queueinterface

Types

StaticQueue[N; T] = object
  face* {...}{.align: 64.}: QueueInterface## The queue's \
## QueueInterface.
## The size of a cache line (64 bytes on x86).
  storage*: array[N, T]## The queue's underlying storage.

A single-producer, single-consumer queue, implemented as a ring buffer, suitable for when the capacity is known at compile-time.

A StaticQueue is aligned along a cache line, since arrays of queues are a common use-case.

  Source Edit

proc newSPSCQueue[N: static int; T](): StaticQueue[N, T]
Initialize a new StaticQueue and validate its capacity.   Source Edit 
proc push[N: static int; T](self: var StaticQueue[N, T]; item: T): bool {...}{.inline.}
Append a single item to the queue. If the queue is full, false is returned. If item is appended, true is returned.   Source Edit 
proc push[N: static int; T](self: var StaticQueue[N, T]; items: openArray[T]): Option[
    seq[T]] {...}{.inline.}
Append multiple items to the queue. If the queue is already full or is filled by this call, some(unpushed) is returned, where unpushed is a seq[T] containing the items which cannot be appended. If all items are appended, none(seq[T]) is returned.   Source Edit 
proc pop[N: static int; T](self: var StaticQueue[N, T]): Option[T] {...}{.inline.}
Pop a single item from the queue. If the queue is empty, none(T) is returned. If an item is popped, some(T) is returned.   Source Edit 
proc pop[N: static int; T](self: var StaticQueue[N, T]; count: int): Option[seq[T]] {...}{.
    inline.}
Pop count items from the queue. If the queue is empty, none(seq[T]) is returned. If > 1 items are popped, some(seq[T]) is returned.   Source Edit 
proc capacity[N: static int; T](self: var StaticQueue[N, T]): int {...}{.inline.}
Return the queue's capacity.   Source Edit
